FuncDef:
The l2tp-user radius-force command specifies the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server for the domain users.
The undo l2tp-user radius-force command cancels the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server for the domain users.
By default, domain users do not use the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server.
ExtraInfo:
L2TP attributes of domain users can be specified in L2TP groups or delivered by the RADIUS server. When the domain users use the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server, you do not need to specify L2TP groups in the domain. The specified L2TP group is also invalid.
The RADIUS server can deliver attributes such as the tunnel type (64), L2TP group name (81), LAC source address (66), LNS address (67), tunnel name (90), tunnel password (69), and tunnel ID (82). If the RADIUS server does not deliver the L2TP group, the device considers users as common PPP users.
The priority of the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server is higher than the L2TP attributes configured in the local L2TP group. For example, if the LNS address is configured to 10.10.10.1 in the L2TP group lac1 on the device, and the RADIUS server delivers LNS address 10.20.20.1 and L2TP group name lac1, LNS address 10.20.20.1 takes effect. If the RADIUS server delivers only L2TP group name lac1, LNS address 10.10.10.1 takes effect.
